IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Effects of Aerobic Exercise on Pain in Patients With Myogenic Temporomandibular Disorders
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Effects of Aerobic Exercise on Pain in Patients With Myogenic Temporomandibular Disorders: A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: Temporomandibular disorders are common in the general population, the myogenic subtype being the most frequent. Central sensitization seems to be present in this pathology, with a decreased pain pressure threshold observed in both local and remote areas. The best evidence-based treatment consists in combining education, manual therapy and therapeutic exercise in both temporomandibular and cervical regions. Aerobic exercise showed to be effective in subjects with chronic pain and central sensitization, by inducing an hypoalgesic effect. However, there isn't investigation about the effects of aerobic exercise in subjects with myogenic temporomandibular disorders and central sensitization. Thus, the aim of the pilot study is to determine if adding aerobic exercise to an effective physical therapy programme is more effective than physical therapy alone to improve pain pressure threshold in subjects with myogenic temporomandibular disorders and suspicion of central sensitization.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription:
Myogenic temporomandibular subjects

Physical therapy combined with aerobic exercise: 30 minutes of physical therapy with education, manual therapy and therapeutic exercise at both temporomandibular and cervical regions, combined with a 30 minutes aerobic exercise programme on a bike.

ArmGroupInterventionName: Other: Physical therapy combined with aerobic exercise

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription:
Myogenic temporomandibular subjects

Physical Therapy: 30 minutes of physical therapy with education, manual therapy and therapeutic exercise at both temporomandibular and cervical regions (same programme than the intervention group)

Intervention.InterventionName: Physical therapy combined with aerobic exercise
Intervention.InterventionDescription: 30 minutes of physical therapy with education, manual therapy and therapeutic exercise at both temporomandibular and cervical regions, combined with a 30 minutes aerobic exercise programme on a bike.
30 minutes of physical therapy with education, manual therapy and therapeutic exercise at both temporomandibular and cervical regions (same programme than the intervention group)

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Pain Pressure Threshold at 2 weeks, 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Bilateral measure with digital algometer: TMJ, masseter, temporal, SCOM, achilles Tendon

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Central Sensitization at 2 weeks, 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Central Sensitization Index: 25 items, from 0 to 100 (0-29=subclinic; 30-39=mild; 40-59=moderate; 60-100=extrem)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Jaw function at 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Helkimo Index: range of movement, pain and function. From 0 to 25 (0=no TMD; 1-9= mild TMD; 10-19= moderate TDM; 20-25=severe TMD)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Cervical global ROM at 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: CROM for global cervical range (flexion, extension, rotations, inclinations)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Upper cervical ROM at 2 weeks, 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Assessment of upper cervical ROM performing the Flexion Rotation Test with a CROM device

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Neck disability at 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Neck Disability Index: from 0 to 50 (0-4= no disability; 5-14=mild; 15-24=moderate; 25-34=severe; 35-50=complete)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Anxiety and depression at 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale: 2 subscales, one for anxiety and the other one for depression. Each scale score is from 0 (less) to 21 (worst)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Sleep Quality at 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index: maximum score of 21; 5 being the cut-off point.

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Perceived change at 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Global Rating of Change scale: 15 points, from -7 (worst) to 7 (best)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change of baseline in Pain intensity at 2 weeks, 1 month (final) and 3 months (post)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Visual Analog Scale: 100mm (no pain to worst pain)

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Diagnosis of a myogenic temporomandibular disorder (DC/TMD) by an odontologist.
A minimum score of 30 in the Central Sensitization Index
Positive FRT

Exclusion Criteria:

History of trauma, TMJ or cervical fracture the past three months
History of TMJ or cervical surgery
Systemic, rheumatic, metabolic, neurologic, psychiatric, pulmonary diseases or neoplastic malignant
History of cardiovascular diseases which contraindicate aerobic exercise
Current orthodontic treatment, splints for bruxism
Drug addiction, alcoholism
Pregnancy
Use of analgesic medication less than 48 hours before each data collection
Physical therapy treatment during the past three months
